feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued September 13 at 3:55PM AKDT until September 16 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 50 to 65 mph with gusts 75 to 95 mph possible. * WHERE...Western and Central Aleutians. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through Friday morning.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Precipitation Wednesday and Wednesday Night... A weather system in the Gulf of Alaska will move over the Eastern Alaska Range tonight, and then over the Fairbanks area on Wed and Wed night before moving east on Thu. This will bring between 0.25-0.50 inch of rain to much of the Eastern Interior, and up to one inch possible in the White Mountains. With snow level falling to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Precipitation Late tonight through Wednesday Night... A weather system in the Gulf of Alaska will move over the Eastern Alaska Range tonight, and then over the Fairbanks area on Wed and Wed night before moving east on Thu. This will bring over one inch of rain to the Alaska Range between Delta and Kantishna.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:16PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: A series of low pressure systems will impact the West Coast with strong winds, heavy rain and coastal flooding beginning late Wednesday and continuing through Saturday. The first and weakest of these Bering Sea storms is a 975 mb low that will move into the Bering Sea to be located 150 nm southwest of St Lawrence Island low Thursday morning. This will bring a
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta
